body_html:
@SsnL Considering this is a thread related to SVD and eig, I thought if I could ask a question here:

Would it be beneficial if we had an option like compute_uv in NumPy for SVD? Both LAPACK and MAGMA seem to support this option, and I think this would make matrix_rank and other implementations depending on the singular values alone faster than earlier.
body_text:
@SsnL Considering this is a thread related to SVD and eig, I thought if I could ask a question here:
Would it be beneficial if we had an option like compute_uv in NumPy for SVD? Both LAPACK and MAGMA seem to support this option, and I think this would make matrix_rank and other implementations depending on the singular values alone faster than earlier.
body:
@SsnL Considering this is a thread related to SVD and eig, I thought if I could ask a question here:

Would it be beneficial if we had an option like `compute_uv` in NumPy for SVD? Both LAPACK and MAGMA seem to support this option, and I think this would make `matrix_rank` and other implementations depending on the singular values alone faster than earlier.
